dc:title: Disgraceful Plight Of Migrant Workers On California Farms
dc:author: Dorothy Day
dc:description: Witnesses the struggles of migrant farm workers in the San Joachin Valley of California and the class war with the big business interests of the Associated Farmers. Is ambivalent about government help for the workers, preferring cooperatives and personal responsibility to corporation farming and birth control clinics for the rural proletariat.
